name: Disney's Beach Club Resort

reviews.text: My family and I stayed at this hotel on our last trip to Disney. All i can say is wow. It really is a lovely hotel. We upgraded to a club room which was fantastic as you have a clubroom which provides snacks, tea and drinks.
reviews.title: One of the Best

reviews.text: The hotel pool is beautiful and we actually used it quite a lot which we never tended to do on disney holidays being so busy with the parks etc.
reviews.title: Great time at the Beach Club

reviews.text: The location is fantastic and the boat rides to the parks are lovely and regular which is good.
reviews.title: BCV - Location, Location, Location

reviews.text: The last hotel we stayed at was the Grand Floridian and this really wasn't that much of a step down. All the staff were friendly and the rooms were lovely and the beds very very comfortable which is very important after a long day out!
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Disney

reviews.text: Would highly reccommend this to any familys and if you can definitely upgrade to a club room if you can its well worth it!
reviews.title: Good option at Disney

reviews.text: Great location! Was in the building closest to Epcot...farthest side away from lobby. 4th floor facing bush. Could see the Epcot golf ball...just barely. Lol. Biggest bonus....5 min walk to the gate. Room more than adequate...left early and only slept there. This side had own pool and hot tub too. No guard. Sign said closed at 11 pm, but staff said we could use if we were quiet and respectful. Main pool was busy and noisy, so this was a nice retreat. Staff great. Buses easy. Amazed at the organization and attention to details. I discovered the Disney magic! :)
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent our 16 day honeymoon at Disneys Beach club. Overall it was an amazing stay and the hotel has some amazing plus points.
reviews.title: Great location and facilities, hotel itself needs a refresh.

reviews.text: Firstly the location is unbeatable, being able to walk to Epcot, Hollywood Studios and the Boardwalk is brilliant. Especially for adults as you really can enjoy the many adult beverages available in Epcot without worrying about transport. The pool (Stormalong Bay) is like a mini waterpark and the dining options are superb. From the convenience of Beach club Marketplace, through the fun atmosphere of Beaches and Cream to the full on fine dining Experience of Yachtsman steakhouse (located in the Yacht Club but pretty much all the same hotel). The staff were great and it was nice to get a warm welcome home from the captain everytime we came back through the lobby.
reviews.title: Wonderful location - Epcot

reviews.text: There were a couple of less than perfect points though. Firstly we had to change rooms as the first we were given was dirty and had a lot of broken fixtures (closet door and drawers broken), we were given another waterview room the next day as one wasnt available until then, and in the meantime the room was cleaned again and the problems fixed, but it wasnt the start we expected from a Disney Deluxe resort. Secondly the wifi in the rooms was very poor, we had to go to the lobby to get a usable signal, not really an issue for us, but with Disney rolling out my magic plus this year it could become one if not improved. Finally, with Cape May Cafe being in the lobby, it can be a bit manic in there at times but again not a major issue.
reviews.title: Lovely Stay at the Beach Club

reviews.text: We are going to Old Key West for our next trip as we would like a little more space and a more relaxed but did consider heading back here, although if we do go back it would be to Yacht Club side as this was a bit more adult and laid back.
reviews.title: Great option for a family of 5!

reviews.text: This resort is fantastic! It is has everything you can ask for. From the time we landed to checkout was perfect...except of course for the weather but that does not stop anyone especially when you are in the happiest place ever! The shuttle to resort, great, hotel check in & out, no problem, room... exceptional (my daughter is borderline OCD, she was happy so perfect), the Cape May restaurant...great seafood dinner buffet, Sandcastles kids club... amazing (my husband and I watched the hockey game at the hotel lounge, while the kids played at the sandcastle kids club, a little pricey but worth it) Transportation to the parks, great, by boat or bus and its free. You can have dinner across the lake at the boardwalk, you can sun bathe at the pool and you feel like you are at the beach. We are definitely coming back to this resort. This is not an r&r type of vacation, you are always on the go but
reviews.title: WOW!! Great resort, amazing location!

reviews.text: it is truly the happiest place ever.
reviews.title: Best of the Best at Disney

reviews.text: This past April our family stayed at Beach club villas in Disney World. The Beach club which is a somewhat livelier half to the Yacht club (They are connected to each other) is located in the Boardwalk area of Disney World. For anyone who has spent time at the Jersey Shore this is visit to your own personal past. For me it brought back memories of my youth staying for two summers with my Aunt and Uncle who lived in Wildwood, NJ and working on the Boardwalk at Mack's pizza. The boardwalk itself probably resembles Cape May, NJ more than Wildwood but nevertheless it aroused fantastic memories for me.
reviews.title: best pool in disney!

reviews.text: The Beach club itself is located just off the boardwalk and only a short walk from the rear entrance to Epcot which is a huge convenience. Though longer, it still is within walking distance to Hollywood Studios in the opposite direction. The grounds are absolutely stunning and if you have the time for just sitting for a bit outside and watching all the vacationers as they approach the marketplace section(which sells souvenirs and sandwiches for breakfast and lunch) is entertaining and enjoyable. Our 2 bedroom villa was spacious and comfortable and always a welcome home place after a long, tiring and fun day at any of the Disney parks. Its not cheap here though as the Beach Club is one of the Disney's deluxe resorts but if you can swing it, for me its the place to stay. It sure has a way of adding to the magic that one always feels when coming here. We have stayed at Port Orleans Riverside and the Wilderness Lodge in recent years and while both were very nice nothing beats the Beach Club. In summary, For me the it's the best.
reviews.title: Beach Club Resort Club Level Vacation
Beachy goodness, at a price
reviews.text: I stayed may 3 to may 8. beautiful hotel with great pool and great bus and boat service to all parks, plus you can walk to epcot and the boardwalk. We loves the sandy bottom pool and the huge pirate water slide.the rooms were very clea and the beds were so comfortable! ive been to disney a lot and stayed at many different hotels and this is my fav. so far!

The concierge lounge was a disgrace so small and uncomfortable. Food choices were poor. The staff was useless. They begin cleaning up and putting everything away 30 full minutes before closing time making you feel like you have to hurry up and leave. We asked the staff about a restaurant reservation and were told, forget it, that place is book solid.... What happened to, let me see if there were any cancelations???
reviews.title: Concierge is a disgrace. The Disney hospitality is missing at this hotel.

reviews.text: The pool area is the only reason we stayed here. It is wonderful for the kids. As an added bonus this hotels location is very good too. Close to Epcot and Hollywood Studios.
reviews.title: It definately has the Disney Magic.

reviews.text: The room was very nice but the view was a total let down. We booked a deluxe water view. The room had a giant tree blocking the view. I called the front desk and I was told that my room used to have a great view but the trees have grown so big it blocks the view. They were unable to move me unless I was willing to downgrade my room category.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Pool, Great Service

reviews.text: While sitting in the rocking chairs near the main entrance, a HUGE rat ran right passed our feet. I know they can't control everything but it was disgusting.
reviews.title: great location and pool but not extraordinary

reviews.text: I've been to Disney more than 50 times. I expected more then I got. The Disney hospitality is severely missing from this hotel.
reviews.title: Just OK

description: Disney's Beach Club wraps leisure, elegance and romance into a full-service New England-style Disney Deluxe Resort. Adjacent to Disney's Yacht and Beach Club Villas Resorts, this resort shares the beachside delights of 25-acre Crescent Lake and the high-spirited fun of Stormalong Bay - a 3-acre water wonderland—featuring waterfalls, a lazy circular river, a waterslide and an elevated tanning deck to let you soak up the sun's golden rays.
